meanings.definition: To outwit or deceive by bluffing.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outbluff her opponent in the card game.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outbluff the salesman and get a better deal on the car.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to outbluff the suspect by pretending to have more evidence than he actually did.
meanings.sent4: In the game of poker, sometimes you have to outbluff your opponents to win the pot.
meanings.sent5: The spy was able to outbluff the enemy agent and extract valuable information.

meanings.definition: To surpass in bluffing or deception.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he couldn't outbluff his cunning rival.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outbluff her friends in games of strategy.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to outbluff the audience by making them believe he could read minds.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was known for his ability to outbluff even the most skeptical individuals.
meanings.sent5: The negotiator was able to outbluff the other party and secure a favorable agreement.
